values.description:
Our Client has an excellent opportunity for a number Java GWT Developers. You will be based out of Dublin City Centre office. Overseas candidates are welcome to apply, but ideally you should be currently eligible to work in the EU / Ireland

Ê

Responsibilities:

  • Ownership of the design and the implementation (estimation, breakdown of tasks) for complex business functional specifications through the full software development lifecycle.
  • Complete ownership of maintenance and support issues as they come up during the project lifecycle – pre and post go-live. Provide technical assistance to other teams – support, QA, business analysis.
  • Evaluate, apply & lead adoption of new technologies and tools within the Engineering teams and across the organisation to provide productivity, efficiency and scalability benefits.
  • Collaborate and share technical and business knowledge to all members of the Engineering and wider organisation.

Ê

Requirements

  • Proven experience developing & designing scalable & high performance GWT frontends / UI for web applications.
  • 3rd level degree in IT/Computer science or related course
  • Experience in JAVA / J2EE developing multi-tier enterprise object-oriented applications.
  • Ability to work with remote team in a distributed development model.
  • Proven Experience in software development using agile methods to deliver scalable & secure Web 2.0 applications.

Ê

Technical Environment:

  • J2EE - Application Servers: BEA Weblogic, IBM Websphere, JBoss / Tomcat
  • Web Presentation Frameworks. Google Web Toolkit (GWT) and GXT.
  • DOJO, EXT-JS, Yahoo Widgets.
  • AJAX frameworks (Expertise in Javscript, CSS, JSP,Ê JSON, JQuery)
  • Spring framework, IOC, Spring JDBC, Spring MVC, ORM
  • Web implementation standards: WS-I standards (interoperability), Java API for XML-based RPC (JAX-RPC), JAX WS, REST, SOAP, WSDL, and UDDI. Ê
  • J2EE design patterns, GoF, GRASP and other design patterns.
  • MVC, MVP, UI patterns, caching patterns, concurrency patterns, validation patterns, Internationalization, Client Memory Management techniques, lazy loading techniques and profiling methods.
  • TDD. Unit testing using JUNIT, TestNG, Cactus or mock objects
  • SVN, branching, code management
  • Build Tools (Ant, Maven)
  • JVM memory management,
  • Profiling tools: JProbe, JProfiler, HP JMeter

Ê

For more information please contact David Shanahan on +353 1 6694040 or david at allenrec.com

values.description:
Curach Consulting, recently acquired by Deloitte, is currently seeking to recruit two experienced Java Developers for contract roles with one of our clients.

Ê

These are 6 month contract roles with potential for extension. The roles will be based onsite at our client’s offices in Celbridge, Co. Kildare. Some periodic work at our clients office in Dublin may be required.

Ê

The successful candidate will work as part of a team developing/maintaining one of our clients key systems.

Ê

Responsibilities/ Role Requirements

ÊÊÊÊÊÊÊÊÊÊÊ Ê

  • Java Developer.
  • Detailing designs for new application modules and interfaces and changes to existing modules and interfaces.
  • Web service development.
  • Coding in adherence to the standards of the application in question.
  • Ensure all deliverables are on schedule.
  • Issue analysis, diagnosis and resolution.
  • Maintaining, tuning and repairing applications in order to keep them performing according to technical and functional specifications.
  • Use of version control of application code.
  • Integration of technical and application components to meet business requirements.
  • Performing preventive maintenance activities.
  • Preparation and maintenance of technical documentation and project manuals.
  • Building and Unit Testing of new modules and interfaces.
  • The production of detailed Unit Test Plans.
  • Providing user support including during User Acceptance Testing.
  • Support for Stress/Load Testing.
  • Release Management in compliance with the client’s operations code deployment standards.
  • Mentoring and facilitating skills transfer to client’s staff.
  • Any other tasks considered by the client to be appropriate to the role.

values.skillsAndExperience:
Required Skills:

  • Java programming (J2EE compliant environment).Ê
  • Development and deployment of Enterprise Java Beans (EJB2/EJB3) and or other java server side frameworks (e.g. Spring, Hibernate, MySQL, etc.).
  • Knowledge of .NET, Visual Basic .NET or C#, SQL Server.
  • HTML / XML / XHTML / XSLT/XSD / WSDL / Javascript / CSS.
  • Oracle Application Server in a large-scale J2EE development (Oracle 9i or higher).
  • Oracle database (Oracle 10g or higher).
  • Development and implementation of web services technology.
  • Working with PL/SQL stored procedures, packages and functions.
  • A good track record in the development and implementation of systems in the specified environment
  • Source control using Microsoft VSS or / and Subversion.
  • Development using Eclipse.
  • Code Building and Deployment using Jakarta ANT.
  • Automated testing using SOAP test harness.
  • Knowledge, understanding of and the use of an OOAD methodology.
  • English Language both spoken and written.
  • Self starter with good problem determination skills.
  • Working effectively within a team and good communication skills.
  • Proven track record in meeting deadlines.
  • Proven track record in providing skills transfer / mentoring.

Ê

Candidates must be available to start in early December.

Ê

This is a six month daily rate contract (with potential for extension) so candiates must be already eligible to work in Ireland.

values.description:
I am recruiting for 2 Senior Customer Solutions Group Software Engineers.

Ê

Arantech’s touchpoint product consists of a JBoss master server and multiple JGroups based slave servers, each of which collect high volume transaction (in the order of 250,000+ events per minute) data from the GSM and 3G network. This data is stored in a multi-terabyte Oracle 10/11g database server. The product uses XML based models to represent and aggregate data coming from the network in an intelligent way. The models also represent the key performance indicators which are made available via the GUI and other components of the product.

Ê

The role within the Customer Solutions Group will primarily focus on the development and maintenance of the XML models used within the product. There are additional components to the product such as Provisioning, Customer Care, Streaming, Pre-Processors and others. These are also areas that the Software Engineer may work in, depending on levels of experience and ability. The right person will play a key role in development of new functionality, extending existing functionality and troubleshooting issues. The Software Engineer will report to the Customer Solutions Group Manager and will be required to contribute to the enhancement and effectiveness of the software and the development process, as well as the quality of the solution we deliver to our customers. This role will require not only a technically strong and flexible candidate, but one who has a genuine interest in both software engineering and mobile telecoms systems.

Ê

Responsible For

  • Responsible for developing/maintaining and troubleshooting product components
  • ÊUnderstand product enhancements under development, as well as requirements behind the product enhancements and translate into high quality functioning software.
  • ÊDevelopment of unit tests for all code written and ensuring code is of high quality.
  • ÊDocumentation of new processes and the maintenance of related documents as necessary.
  • ÊDisciplined reporting, tracking, and resolution of solution defects.

Ê

Duties/Activities

Ê

  • Development in XML, java and groovy
  • Support customers when issues arise
  • Take part in process improvement activities
  • Development in XML, java and groovy
  • Support customers when issues arise
  • Take part in process improvement activities

Minimum:

  • Strong experience/knowledge of XML and complex logic handling within XML.
  • Excellent UNIX command line knowledge and skills: awk, sed, etc.
  • Very good UNIX scripting skills, text processing/parsing: Bash, Perl etc.
  • Good SQL and database knowledge - Oracle - SQL/PLSQL.
  • Very good understanding of HTTP, FTP, DNS, email protocols, etc.
  • Strong experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript.
  • A good working knowledge of Java (J2EE).
  • Excellent problem solving and trouble shooting skills.
  • Demonstrable ability to understand complex software functionality.
  • Mobile Telecommunications knowledge a big advantage (GSM, GPRS, UMTS, LTE).
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to work within and across teams are essential.

Ê

Bonus:

  • A good working knowledge of Groovy or Python or Ruby or any other dynamic scripting language.
  • Understanding of/Knowledge of Build & Test Frameworks such as Ant, Maven, Bamboo, etc.
    • ?

Background

  • Degree/Diploma in Computer Science, Telecommunications or Engineering.
  • Experience in the software industry (preferably within Telecoms).

Ê

values.description:
AOL Mobile

Ê

At AOL Mobile, we're redefining the way users consume information and connect with each other. We deliver innovative, high quality mobile applications that become part of the user's everyday life. With over 50 apps and millions of downloads,
our team is responsible for AOL's core mobile applications across the mobile spectrum.

Software Engineer (AOL Mobile, Dublin)


AOL is hiring superstar engineers to develop software for mobile devices. We're looking for a passionate, delivery-oriented application developer to design and implement our core mobile apps on the iOS platform. Hard problems must excite
you, and you should feel that quality of code and user experience needs to be baked into your code from the beginning.

Ê

Mobile development skills

Ê

• Strong object oriented programming and design skills

Ê

• 2 years development in Objective-C and Cocoa, C++

Ê

• Extensive experience with Xcode, Interface Builder, iOS SDK

Ê

• Experience with Instruments

Ê

• Experience with Android or other Mobile platforms desired

Ê

• Experience with version control systems (CVS, Subversion, Git)

Ê

values.description:
Java Developer


If you join Accenture you can make great ideas happen for some of the world's most dynamic companies. With broad global resources and deep technical know-how, we collaborate with clients to cultivate ideas and deliver results. Choose a career at Accenture and enjoy an innovative environment where challenging and interesting work is part of daily life.

As a Java Developer specific responsibilities may include:

Application Development:-

  • Working with Business users to agree on requirements and specifications

  • Documenting functional and technical designs for your area of work

  • Developing key components in Java and Flex according to a project plan

  • Experience with requirements gathering and system design would be desirable.

  • Quite close interaction with business users is required and as such a desire to be customer facing along with the appropriate soft skills is necessary.

  • Building of prototypes, development of applications and build of interfaces with legacy, enterprise resource planning and other enterprise systems


Application Maintenance

  • Responding to incident support tickets & identifying the causes behind any application failure.

  • Following the identification of these root causes, identify an immediate quick fix, or work around. These quick fixes may involve the manipulation of XML messages and/or database fields. Where possible long term code fixes for these failures should be made, tested and included in an appropriate build.

  • Other duties - the role will also involve taking full responsibility for maintaining and versioning code bases, and providing valid and tested application builds for deployment to all environments including production.

• Third level computer qualification and/or relevant industry experience
• Two to three years experience in full life-cycle development, including design, coding, testing, rollout and support
• Java J2EE Experience
• Flex development experience is desirable
• Strong creative problem solving and analytical skills
• Team player

• Strong oral and written communications skills

• Strong client service skills


Our people are our most important asset and we invest considerable resources to provide on-going training that builds and extends professional, technical and management skills in all areas. Your learning program will be determined by the requirements of your specific role but will usually involve specialized skills as well as personal and leadership development. You will work with your manager to determine what skills you need and how to build them.
Accenture is a global management consulting, technology services and outsourcing company. Committed to delivering innovation, Accenture collaborates with its clients to help them become high-performance businesses and governments. With deep industry and business process expertise, broad global resources and a proven track record, Accenture can mobilize the right people, skills and technologies to help clients improve their performance. With more than 123,000 people in 48 countries, the company generated net revenues of US$15.55 billion for the fiscal year ended Aug. 31, 2005. Its home page is www.accenture.com.

values.description:
Salesforce is seeking a Customer-Centric Engineer (CCE) to work on a new team within R&D responsible for the handling of escalations from our Tier 3 Support organization. The CCE will setup, reproduce, troubleshoot, and solve complex issues while providing timely information to support engineers to improve overall customer satisfaction. This development-focused candidate will figure out a way to "find the bug," by utilizing top-notch troubleshooting techniques, all of the tools and systems available within the R&D organization, and by digging deep into the code. Need a debugging, logging, or monitoring tool that doesn't exist? Partner with other R&D groups and write it! The CCE will propose fixes and work closely with the appropriate R&D team so that each fix is properly code-reviewed.

Ê

The ideal candidate has developer-level technical chops along with a strong desire to interact with customers, support engineers, and management on high-profile issues critical to the long-term success of the company. Mentoring Support on technical issues and best practices is also a key measurement of success. The successful candidate will have an accelerated path to a leadership role in the organization. There may be an opportunity for international travel in the future; for now, this position requires no to minimal travel.

Ê

Required Skills:


  • 2-5Êyears of application development experience, QA roles, and/or Tier 3 Support for a complex server-side platform

  • Deep understanding of Java and J2EE

  • Deep understanding of production database usage and SQL

  • Familiar with Oracle clustering technologies (e.g. RAC, Grid, OPS)

  • Familiar with XML (SOAP/Web Services)

    Unparalleled troubleshooting and problem-solving skills

  • Outstanding attention to detail

  • Comfortable interacting with all levels of management

  • Bachelor’s degree in CS is preferred

Ê

Desired skills:


  • Prior experience with authoring applications in Apex and Visualforce

  • Front end web development technologies such as Javascript and AJAX

  • Regular contributor to Apex and Visualforce Community message boards a plus

values.description:
Ê

Passionate,curious, creative? Our employees have helped to create popular and engaging online products and destinations that attract over 150 million unique visitors each month globally.Ê

Our Global Search team is looking for a talented engineer to help AOL to continue to grow.

Ê

We look for people that are exceptionally imaginative, collaborative, and truly psyched about our mission to inform, entertain and connect the world.

Ê

Responsibilities

  • Work as part of the technical team that designs, develops, implements and maintains AOL Global Search systems
  • Work closely with UI/Design and Product teams to ensure successful implementation of new features and integration with other Aol web applications.
  • Converts specifications/requirements into features and works with back-end developers to create database-driven solutions for functional web pages.
  • Well versed in behavior related to the use of different DOCTYPE declarations, character encoding, W3C standards compliance and accessibility issues
  • Understand and adhere to industry and AOL best practices for delivering fast loading web sites
  • Is an active participant in an Agile development environment
  • Break down projects into tasks with level-of-effort estimation
  • Proactively identify and communicate progress, status and issues
  • Work in a team environment with other developers, designers, quality engineers, product managers, business analysts etc.

values.skillsAndExperience:
Qualifications

Ê

  • Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related field with a minimum of 2 years related experience in a Java web development environment
  • 2+ years experience in front end web development using J2EE, HTML, XHTML, CSS, AJAX, XML, Javascript/jQuery
  • An understanding of how design affects web sites and comprehensive knowledge of developing interactive web pages (CSS and HTMLmarkup)
  • Knowledge of cross-browser/cross-platform compatibility
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Ability to troubleshoot and resolve issues across browsers (e.g. Javascript, jQuery, CSS and HTML).
  • Demonstrated understanding of backend services and environments for developing web pages (Linux, Apache, Tomcat, REST & server architecture).
  • Experience developing in a standards-based environment using version control software (SVN or CVS and IDEs such as Eclipse or NetBeans)
  • Ability to work independently with limited supervision and learn quickly in a dynamic environment

Ê

AOL is a leading global web services company with a substantial worldwide audience, a suite of powerful web brands and industry leading products, and one of the largest advertising networks in the United States.

AOL is an equal opportunity employer.
